variants.Description in input context: A G-to-A transition at codon 306 in the SNCA gene, leading to the substitution of glycine with aspartic acid at position 102 in the alpha-synuclein protein.

Material used.Description: The experiment was conducted using the SH-SY5Y cell line transiently transfected with plasmids expressing the SNCA variant.

Readout description.Result Description: The SNCA variant showed increased aggregation and reduced clearance compared to wild-type, as measured by fluorescence intensity and co-localization with ubiquitin.

Biological replicates.Description: Three independent biological replicates were performed for each condition.

Technical replicates.Description: Each experiment was repeated three times technically.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type SNCA-expressing cells were used as a positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: Empty vector-transfected cells were used as a negative control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Two-way ANOVA with post-hoc Tukey's test was used for statistical analysis.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Fluorescence intensity less than 150% of wild-type control.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Fluorescence intensity greater than 200% of wild-type control.
